== Early life and education ==

sentences: Early life and education
section: == Early life and education ==
== Early life and education ==

sentences: Tunstall was born to a half-Chinese, half-Scottish mother, Carol Anne (or Carol-Ann), who was from Hong Kong, and an Irish father.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Her parents met while her mother was working as a dancer in Penthouse bar in Edinburgh, where her father was a bartender.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: She never met her biological father.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: She was born at Edinburgh's Western General Hospital and at 18 days old, was placed for adoption by her mother with a family in St Andrews, Fife, Scotland.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Her adoptive father, David Tunstall, was a physics lecturer at the University of St Andrews, and her adoptive mother, Rosemarie Tunstall, was a primary school teacher; they already had adopted another child who became her older brother Joe, and went on to have another son, Dan.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Tunstall has said: "My earliest memories are Californian", from a sabbatical that her father took at the University of California, Los Angeles in 1979.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: She was musically oriented and her adoptive parents supported her interest.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: She recollected that she asked for a piano when she was four.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Tunstall grew up in St Andrews, Fife, attending Lawhead Primary, then Madras College in St. Andrews and the High School of Dundee, but she spent her last year of high school in the United States at the Kent School, a selective boarding school in Kent, Connecticut.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: She spent time busking on Church Street in Burlington, Vermont, and at a commune in rural Vermont.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Tunstall studied at Royal Holloway, University of London.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: She graduated with a Bachelor of Arts in Drama & Music in 1996.
section: == Early life and education ==

sentences: Royal Holloway conferred an honorary doctorate in science on her in 2011 for her work on environmental issues as a musician.
section: == Early life and education ==

== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Tunstall tracked down her biological mother, Carol Anne, located c. 1996–1998, and learned that she was married to cab driver David Orr and had borne three more children.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She has been critical of the British National Party.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2010, she publicly disowned Orr because of his decision to run as a BNP candidate in the general election for Livingston.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2019, she appeared in Series 9 of Long Lost Family.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: By that time, the media attention had been too much for Carol Anne, and she was grateful to KT ("She has given me a new lease on life.") for having relocated her somewhere far away, in Southern Spain.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She learned that her biological father, John (surname not revealed), had  passed away in 2002 (at age 49), but she was united with two half-sisters, Siobhan and Lesley-Anne, by John's second marriage.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Tunstall's first name is Kate, but she chooses to use her initials KT (pronounced "Katie") instead, saying "[Kate] just makes me think of a buxom lass baking bread for her man working in the fields.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: I have no problem with that, but it's just not really how I pictured being a rock star."
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: The spelling KT, as opposed to Katie, also differentiates Tunstall from fellow singer Katie Melua.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: She also said that she derived "KT" from K–T impact, the name of a geological event that caused the extinction of dinosaurs.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Her father, David Tunstall, was a lecturer in physics at St Andrews University.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: The title of her debut album, Eye to the Telescope, alludes to her experiences with scientific equipment at her father's laboratory.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2003, Tunstall began dating Luke Bullen, the drummer in her band.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: On Christmas Day, 2007, Bullen proposed to her at her parents' home in St Andrews, Scotland, and the couple were married in September 2008.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: They divorced in May 2013, after separating the year before.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Tunstall sparked some controversy in 2005 when she publicly criticised singer/songwriter Dido, stating that the artist "can't fucking sing" after several fans compared the two musically.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Tunstall later apologised, stating that she did not want to be involved in a public feud.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2007, Tunstall joined the Disko Bay Cape Farewell expedition to the West Coast of Greenland in September 2008.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Cape Farewell is a British-based arts organisation that brings artists, scientists and communicators together to instigate a cultural response to climate change.
section: == Personal life ==
== Health ==

sentences: Health ==
section: == Health ==

sentences: In April 2007, Tunstall underwent surgery to correct an undersized kidney, a problem caused by a childhood infection.
section: == Health ==

sentences: In 2008, Tunstall started experiencing problems with the hearing in her left ear.
section: == Health ==

sentences: Hearing problems have always been a worry to her; a brother of hers was profoundly deaf since birth.
section: == Health ==

sentences: By 2018, the problem had progressed to full left-ear hearing loss and balance problems.
section: == Health ==

sentences: In July 2021, she announced that she was having to pull out of her summer tour dates and permanently avoid lengthy runs of closely consecutive performances, citing issues with her right ear which were "exactly how the breakdown of my left ear began".
section: == Health ==

sentences: She did perform some solo shows in early summer, including the Spring Hill Arts Gathering (SHAG) in June in Washington Depot, Connecticut.[1]
section: == Health ==

== Awards and nominations == | === Awards overview ===

sentences: In Tunstall's breakthrough year, 2005, she received a nomination for the Mercury Music Prize, which eventually went to Antony and the Johnsons; and she won the Best Track of the year award from Q magazine for "Black Horse and the Cherry Tree".
section: == Awards and nominations == | === Awards overview ===

sentences: In January of 2006, she received three BRIT nominations—best British Live Act, best British Breakthrough Act, and best British Female Solo Artist—eventually gaining the award for best British Female Solo Artist, remarking that she wished to share it with fellow nominee Kate Bush.
section: == Awards and nominations == | === Awards overview ===

sentences: Later the same month she was given a European Border Breakers Award, which recognises the top-selling European Union artists outside their home country.
section: == Awards and nominations == | === Awards overview ===

sentences: Also in 2006, she won the Ivor Novello Best Song Musically and Lyrically for "Suddenly I See", along with Scottish Style Awards "Most Stylish Band or Musician".
section: == Awards and nominations == | === Awards overview ===

sentences: She gained more nominations in 2007 and 2008: a 2007 Grammy Award nomination for Best Female Pop Vocal Performance for "Black Horse and the Cherry Tree" (the award went to Christina Aguilera for "Ain't No Other Man"), and another BRIT nomination for British Female Solo Artist, the award she had won in 2006.
section: == Awards and nominations == | === Awards overview ===
